channel.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
channel.description:
First Question: Okay, so I edited my Media.jag files to make the off teleports look as if they are on. Here is what I did.
[img]http://oi43.tinypic.com/o8f637.jpg[/img]
But the teleports still look like this
[img]http://oi43.tinypic.com/2lms5z6.jpg[/img]
How do I make those update? I pressed Save Archive after I finished editing the pictures.
Quesion 2: What file holds all the animations in Tom's Cache Suite? I want to transfer animations from one server, over to another.
Question 3: What file holds all the maps in Tom's Cache Suite? I want to transfer maps from one server, over to another.
Thank you for your time!

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:14, topic:523536”]i wasn’t referring to the name of the class. the class itself which handles interfaces

refactored: RsInterface
non: Class9[/quote]
Fixed anyways Thanks for help!

Read full topic

item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Vain_:

check the interface class? see if it draws out every single sprite or not

I don’t have an interface class. It’s a Pi

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:10, topic:523536”]is the entire magic interface hardcoded, or simply additional (Home) teleport?

if the entire thing is not hardcoded (still loaded from the cache) please use an interface editor.

edit the RequireValues index array to -1

should do the trick[/quote]
How would i know if it is hardcoded?

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

is the entire magic interface hardcoded, or simply additional (Home) teleport?

if the entire thing is not hardcoded (still loaded from the cache) please use an interface editor.

edit the RequireValues index array to -1

should do the trick

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Mike_101994 Mike 101994
item.description:
@Mike_101994 wrote:

What I was trying to mention is that even though you have a magic icon packed, that may not be the image file that is being called on by your code. Someone else may have implemented their own magic teleports and put them somewhere else in your cache directory. I would suggest going through your code and see what image is being called when it is implemented into your rs interface. Seeing as you have already packed new teleports into your packable cache suggests you either packed it wrong, which if that is the case I don’t know what to say, or there is another image out there being used for your magicoff.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Mike 101994:

Yea, it could be any image in your client folder that looks like the one you are trying to change.

That’s not quite what I meant. But that’s not the problem anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @Mike_101994 Mike 101994
item.description:
@Mike_101994 wrote:

item.title: [Pi] Few Cache Questions [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Mike 101994:

b00mz, if changing your icons in tom’s cache editor isn’t working there could be an unpacked folder somewhere in your client where the icons are instead.

I dont believe there are any other folders than the cache and sign, could it possibly be a file, or an image? I have a random attack.png image in my client folder, could it be that?

Read full topic

item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“u loose, post:2, topic:523536”]Make sure to compile after you have edited your cache.

If you’re updating your maps from 317 to 525 for example you will not only have to edit through toms cache editor but you will need to add some codes[/quote]
Lmao you don’t need to compile after editing your cache…

Read full topic
